title: General form
text: If "F varies jointly with the square of v and with A" then the general form of our relationship will be $$F=kvA$$.

title: Finding k
text: The constant k can be found by dividng $$\frac{F}{vA}$$.

title: Evaluating k
text: k $$=\frac{F}{vA}$$. If $$F=15$$ when $$A=40$$ and $$v=20$$, what is k?

title: Finding new distance
text: Now we know our relationship is $$0.01875F v A$$ To find the new force on a surface with an area of $$65$$ sq. ft. and velocity of $$30$$, just plug in $$A=65$$ and $$v=30!$$ Round to two decimal places.
